result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
2:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Mariah M Shipley.  Defendant's appearance is waived.
State requests the defendant be discharged from the commitment under 971.14(6).  State requests the defendant be discharged from conditions of bond and to suspend proceedings indefinitely.
No objection by the Defense.
Court finds the defendant not competent and not likely to become competent within the statutory commitment period.
Court orders the criminal proceedings be suspended and the defendant discharged from the criminal competency commitment.  Court orders the defendant be released from custody and from the conditions of bond.
Cash bond to be refunded to poster.

No use or possession of dangerous weapons.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B (or their residences or by electronic means) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.
